q1.question: Do you have any of these symptoms?
contents: Severe difficulty breathing, for example, you’re struggling to breathe or you can only speak in single words
Severe chest pain
Having a very hard time waking up
Feeling confused
Losing consciousness

q2.question: Do you have any of these symptoms?
contents: I cannot lie down because I'm having trouble breathing
I'm having trouble managing my chronic health conditions because of difficulty breathing

q3.question: Do you have any of these other symptoms?
contents: Select all the symptoms you have right now. If you dont have any of these symptoms, select 'none of the above.'

q4.question: Have you received a new COVID-19 test result?
contents: If you have not entered it here before, please enter the details of your last COVID-19 test

hwq1.question: Are you moderately to severely immunocompromised?
contents: You’ve had an organ transplant and are taking anti-rejection medications
You’ve had a bone marrow or stem cell transplant
You are receiving treatment for cancer
You’ve been diagnosed with a moderate to severe primary immunodeficiency disorder
You have advanced or untreated HIV
You are on dialysis and/or have severe kidney disease
You are on active treatment with immunosuppressive therapies

hwq2.question: Do you have any one of the following conditions?
contents: You have cystic fibrosis

You have severe COPD, asthma or another serious respiratory condition. For example, you are on long-term home oxygen, are being assessed for a lung transplant, or you have severe pulmonary arterial hypertension, severe pulmonary fibrosis, or severe interstitial lung disease
You’ve been diagnosed with a rare blood disorder or inborn error of metabolism
You’ve had a splenectomy, or you have functional asplenia
You have diabetes and are being treated with insulin
You have a significant developmental disability
You have a condition or syndrome that causes muscle weakness around the lungs requiring the use of a ventilator or continuous bi-PAP

hwq3.question: Are you pregnant?
contents: This information helps us find the best testing options for you.

hwq4.question: Do you self-identify as Indigenous?
contents: This information helps us find the best testing options for you. Proof of ancestry is not required.

hwq5.question: Please select your COVID-19 vaccination status:
contents: This information helps us find the best testing options for you.
Not vaccinated against COVID-19
I have received 1 or 2 doses of a 2-dose series like Pfizer, Moderna, Novavax or AstraZeneca.
I have received 1 dose of a 1-dose series like Johnson & Johnson.
I am fully vaccinated (completed my vaccine series) and I have also received a booster dose.

hwq6.question: How old are you?
contents: 49 years old or younger
50 to 69 years old
70 years old or older

hwq7m.question: Do you have 3 or more chronic conditions?
contents: For example, do you have obesity, diabetes, or a neurological condition? Or have you had heart failure or a stroke?

hwq7s.question: Do you have 1 or more chronic conditions?
contents: For example, do you have obesity, diabetes, or a neurological condition? Or have you had heart failure or a stroke?

severity.difficultBreathing: How severe is your shortness of breath?
severity.soreThroat: How severe is your sore throat?
severity.nauseaVomiting: How severe is your nausea or vomiting?
severity.bodyAches: How severe are your body aches?

call911.title: Your symptoms require emergency medical care.

call811.title: You should get health advice.
contents: Contact your health care provider or call 8-1-1 to talk to a nurse at HealthLink BC.

asymptomatic.title: You do not need a COVID-19 test.
contents: If your symptoms change, retake this self-assessment to see if you need testing.

symptomaticNeedTest.title: Please get a COVID-19 test and self-isolate.
contents: If you test negative for COVID-19, stay home until you feel better.

symptomaticNoNeedTest.title: You do not need a COVID-19 test.
contents: Testing is not recommended for adults and children with mild symptoms. Stay home until you feel well enough to resume your regular activities. Avoid high risk settings (e.g. long term care facilities) and individuals at higher risk for severe complications for 10 days after the start of your symptoms.

rapidTest.title: Stay home and away from others until you feel well enough to return to your regular activities and you no longer have a fever.
contents: You can use a rapid COVID-19 test if you'd like.
Rapid antigen testing kits are free for everyone. Visit your local pharmacy and ask for your testing kit.
